blog.title: Ao3-Feed: Tony Stark
blog.description: This blog is an automated list of the stories posted on Archive Of Our Own under the Tony Stark tag. The stories are automatically posted here from the AO3 RSS feed.

summary: we're slowly dancing (in a burning room)
title: we're slowly dancing (in a burning room)
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2IYQcoj

by tunastork (mariexa)

The space stone leads them to Vormir.

Just the two of them. Together. It feels like a distant promise. It feels like fate.

Steve never believed in no win scenarios.

Words: 1220, Chapters: 1/1, Language: English

  • Rating: Not Rated
  • Warnings: Major Character Death
  • Categories: M/M
  • Characters: Steve Rogers, Tony Stark
  • Relationships: Steve Rogers/Tony Stark
  • Additional Tags: Post-Avengers: Infinity War Part 1 (Movie), Avengers: Infinity War Part 1 (Movie) Spoilers, Not Avengers: Endgame (Movie) Compliant, Vormir, Sacrifice, Soul Stone, it’s sad hours time

tags: i love you all so much
otp: all i can think of is him
summary: I’m just about to log off until after I see Endgame but I just want to say a quick thank you first. A thank you to everyone who...
body: I’m just about to log off until after I see Endgame but I just want to say a quick thank you first. A thank you to everyone who follows this blog and a thank you to the entire stevetony community on here. A thank you to this wonderful, kind, witty, funny and loving group of people that I’ve been so so proud to be a member of for the past two and a half years. The entire dynamic is going to change after Endgame and change is good, as is closure, but I still want to send a kind thought out there to everyone who’s grown this community to what it’s been today. Whether you were one of the first fic writers way back in 2008/2009, a brilliant artist, a textpost/meme creator or just someone who really loves these characters and likes and shares and encourages the rest of us. It’s been such a beautiful experience for me, as I hope it has been for the rest of us. You’ll be hard-pressed to find another community like it on the internet, one with the same heart. Thank you stevetonies, thank you for everything. I’ll see you all the other side and I can’t wait to spend many more years with you all.

summary: do you have any trophy husband tony headcannons?
question: do you have any trophy husband tony headcannons?
answer:
-he LIVES for decorative aprons….makes them for special occasions 

-he’s the type of husband to have all coordinating christmas decorations and “themes” throughout the house 

-owns a million scrapbooks (that rhodey and peter both smile at later) 

-dirt? in his kitchen? no, i think NOT 

-he makes such cute desserts for his kids and other avengers’ kids when they want some he’s just Good 

-Peak Eyeliner skills 

-always coordinating his shoes with his jewelry! when have you ever! 

-has a regular day to go grocery shopping and a regular cashier (he only goes to Miss Diana, the Best Ever) 

fresh flowers are delivered every week without fail 

-he DEMANDS a kiss from rhodey when he gets home,,,he did not work all day to be ignored in favor of the recliner (not that rhodey would…but it is tempting)

blog.name: lemonsandstrawberries
blog.title: Stony fics blog
blog.description:
A blog dedicated to Stony (Steve Rogers x Tony Stark, Marvel) fanfiction and Stony in general (mostly tickle fics). Will contain a lot of fics, some stony posts and some private whining and all the good stuff! Browse the masterpost, read fics, and enjoy your stay!

NOT ACCEPTING PROMPTS
MASTERPOST

title: Science
body:
fandom: Stony (Steve x Tony), MCU

summary: Steve watches Tony during delivering a lecture when Natasha asks a very relevant question.

length: 766

warnings: brushes on the topic of sex and arousal, but very subtle, non explicit

a/n: okay, guys, this is the last you will hear from me, until I see Endgame! which will be this Thursday. let’s keep our fingers crossed and I hope you enjoy the fic!

——————–

Science / **

“That’s one approach to the theory. But! When you take into consideration the-”

Steve was sitting in the front row in a conference room built to host over sixty people, among professors and scientists, during a study on a physics topic, he wasn’t even able to repeat the name. Something about statistical thermodynamics. Or something. It wasn’t an environment he belonged in. Not that he was unable to understand, he just wasn’t interested. He came here for support.

Tony was on the small podium, on the background of a screen displaying charts and graphics, confirming his words. He was in his element, delivering a speech, that was about to change the world. The world of physics anyway.

“Just look at this,” Natasha whispered, sitting on Steve’s left and leaning closer to him, “he has everyone in the palm of his hand.”

Steve discreetly looked around the conference room, trying to overlook the extremely bored looking Sam on his right, as the whole Avengers team was invited to the conference, and they didn’t come as much as for support as to abuse room service and take advantage of the luxurious hotel. He focused on the people gathered, for the first time noticing, that the room was full and even some people were crowding near the walls, not getting a seat. Women in elegant two-piece dresses were listening to Tony with heated cheeks, some of them holding a palm pressed on their chest to calm down their quickly beating hearts. Men in suits, nodding in approval, taking in every word. Everyone seemed in trance and Tony was the hypnotizer. Steve looked back to the stage and at his husband. Of course, that Tony was in the center of attention, always able to grasp everyone’s attention. If he ordered everyone to stand up and do five jumping jacks, Steve was sure there won’t be a single person who wouldn’t listen. His husband was charismatic, charming and incredibly smart. Also, damn handsome, but maybe it wasn’t what counted the most here, but was an added bonus. Everyone adored him.

“Are you jealous?” Natasha asked in a teasing voice, smiling at the soldier.

Steve tried to keep his face neutral and his jaw slack. Was he jealous of everyone looking at Tony and eating him alive?

‘Steve…’

A breathed out, hot whisper.

'Ah! Steve!’

More need. It became hotter.

'Ah ah! STEVE!’

The opened mouth, framed in a dark goatee, lips forming an o shape. Their hot, sweat covered bodies pressed to each other, Tony nearly disappearing under Steve’s solid, muscled frame. The nail marks on his back healed in minutes, but he could still feel the way Tony had scratched him, trying to last and draw out the pleasure for both of them. The tanned body quivering under him, clenching and unclenching when hot waves of ecstasy went through him. His name being moaned out over and over again, nearly screamed out when the pleasure blinded him, and then small, blissful whispers, and tremble of the exhausted body.

'Mhhmm… Steve…’

Mouth on mouth, they kissed, long and needing, Steve still gently rocking his hips into Tony with a wonderful, wet sound, just to be together for a bit more.

'Ahhh… Ahhh…’

“Steve… Steve!”

“Umph!” Steve yelped, when an elbow was slammed into his ribs, and Sam almost fell out of his chair because of the ruckus. They all made innocent faces and tried to pretend that nothing happened, and when people turned their outraged eyes away from them, Steve looked at Natasha.

“What?” he hissed, his ribs still hurting after the punch.

“I asked if you are jealous,” she reminded, not liking the way Steve spaced out and left her hanging.

Steve didn’t answer right away and looked back to the podium. Tony was behind the rostrum and delivering his ending statement. He moved away and took a walk along the stage and with the first step, Steve noticed the slightest stumble, the briefest twitch of the lips when pain shot up his spine - the reminder of the last night.

“No,” Steve answered to Natasha, smiling in some mysterious way, dark blue eyes focused on his husband. “No, I am not jealous.”

When Tony ended his lecture, Steve wasn’t the only to stand up and clap enthusiastically as Tony took a theatrical bow and thanked for the attention, but he was the only one allowed to make it to the podium and kiss his brilliant husband, in front of everybody. Natasha shook her head and clapped together with everyone, smiling at the two people crazy in love with each other.

'Ah ah! STEVE!’

The opened mouth, framed in a dark goatee, lips forming an o shape. Their hot, sweat covered bodies pressed to each other, Tony nearly disappearing under Steve’s solid, muscled frame. The nail marks on his back healed in minutes, but he could still feel the way Tony had scratched him, trying to last and draw out the pleasure for both of them. The tanned body quivering under him, clenching and unclenching when hot waves of ecstasy went through him. His name being moaned out over and over again, nearly screamed out when the pleasure blinded him, and then small, blissful whispers, and tremble of the exhausted body.

'Mhhmm… Steve…’

Mouth on mouth, they kissed, long and needing, Steve still gently rocking his hips into Tony with a wonderful, wet sound, just to be together for a bit more.

'Ahhh… Ahhh…’

“Steve… Steve!”

“Umph!” Steve yelped, when an elbow was slammed into his ribs, and Sam almost fell out of his chair because of the ruckus. They all made innocent faces and tried to pretend that nothing happened, and when people turned their outraged eyes away from them, Steve looked at Natasha.

“What?” he hissed, his ribs still hurting after the punch.

“I asked if you are jealous,” she reminded, not liking the way Steve spaced out and left her hanging.

Steve didn’t answer right away and looked back to the podium. Tony was behind the rostrum and delivering his ending statement. He moved away and took a walk along the stage and with the first step, Steve noticed the slightest stumble, the briefest twitch of the lips when pain shot up his spine - the reminder of the last night.

“No,” Steve answered to Natasha, smiling in some mysterious way, dark blue eyes focused on his husband. “No, I am not jealous.”

When Tony ended his lecture, Steve wasn’t the only to stand up and clap enthusiastically as Tony took a theatrical bow and thanked for the attention, but he was the only one allowed to make it to the podium and kiss his brilliant husband, in front of everybody. Natasha shook her head and clapped together with everyone, smiling at the two people crazy in love with each other.
trail.content_abstract:
fandom: Stony (Steve x Tony), MCU

summary: Steve watches Tony during delivering a lecture when Natasha asks a very relevant question.

length: 766

warnings: brushes on the topic of sex and arousal, but very subtle, non explicit

a/n: okay, guys, this is the last you will hear from me, until I see Endgame! which will be this Thursday. let’s keep our fingers crossed and I hope you enjoy the fic!

——————–

Science / **

“That’s one approach to the theory. But! When you take into consideration the-”

Steve was sitting in the front row in a conference room built to host over sixty people, among professors and scientists, during a study on a physics topic, he wasn’t even able to repeat the name. Something about statistical thermodynamics. Or something. It wasn’t an environment he belonged in. Not that he was unable to understand, he just wasn’t interested. He came here for support.

But mostly Ironstrange, Marvel ladies, lgbt stuff and shit posts | my inbox is always open, and you can message me anytime (read: please message me and send me asks) | on this blog, we accept all the parts of the lgbtqia+ community, we love people of all colors, we don't tolerate pedophilia and incest, and respect Tony Potts (🅱lease DNI if you don't do the same) | Icon by. summary: Fun pining Stephen scenes for Doctor Strange 2
title: Fun pining Stephen scenes for Doctor Strange 2
body:
• Stephen flicks between dimension like it’s a TV, switching them every two seconds, seeming bored. He only wants to check that everything is alright, moving on to the next dimension if everything seems fine. Suddenly, a dimension makes him pause. Clearly, he knows this one. He cares about it. He looks at it like he wishes he was there. It shows him, kissing someone, smiling. Stephen is happy in there. You can only see the back of that someone’s head. Stephen hears a noise and startles, switching to another one, just before you can see it was Tony he was kissing.
  • Wong brings him the newspaper. He tells him, “you might not want to look at it.” Obviously, that tempts Stephen and he flips the newspaper that was facing down over, revealing the cover. A picture of a married Tony Stark and Pepper Potts. Stephen’s face expression falls. Wong sighs, “I told you not to.” Stephen doesn’t respond, staring at the picture. “Do you want to talk about it?” “No.”
  • Stephen is struggling with a nightmare. You can see snippets of his nightmare. It’s Tony getting stabbed, Tony lost in space, Tony being miserable or dead in any reality possible. Stephen is awoken, faintly whispering Tony’s name. He seems to be sweating and panicking. However, before calming himself down, he fumbles for his sling ring. He opens a portal and you can see through it a sleeping Tony and Pepper. Wincing, Stephen closes the portal. He seems more relaxed but he also seems depressed. He lets out a few sobs before astral projecting away from his room.
  • Peter is texting with him and Stephen asks after Tony. He tries to make it seem casual but he doesn’t know if he succeeds. He cares about the answer, waiting for Peter to reply anxiously. Peter tells him he hasn’t really talked to him since Pepper gave birth. Stephen purses his lips at the phone and sighs. 
  • Stephen is taking his frustration out in his training. Using his whip to try and beat off an invisible opponent. A few students are looking frightened but Stephen doesn’t notice them. The space between every lash of the whip starts getting shorter and all you can hear is just whip slicing through the air. “Did Stark piss you off?” “Go away, Wong.” “You know, you tend to make impulsive decisions when pining. Will you cut off someone’s head this time?” “When did you start developing a sense of humor?” “I’ll leave you alone then.”

I don’t have anymore so I’m tagging people who I think this might be up their ally. @ssironstrange @amethyst-noir @merelypassingtime @anyone else who has an idea, do you want to help me make more Stephen angst?

tags: it all boils down to tony living
I know peter will be back
title: Things I Need in Endgame
body:
1. My Peter boy back.

2. Tony needs to LIVE.

3. Tony needs to get married, have kids, and enjoy his well-earned happy ending.

4. All of which requires him living. Tony needs to live.

5. Tony and Peter need to hug.

6. Tony Stark needs to LIVE.

blog.name: peterneedsahugparker
blog.title: Give Me Peter Whump To Write About
blog.description:
Me? Put my son through everything? It’s more likely then you think.

Send me prompts!

Home of Peter Parkrawr

summary: # 2 for the prompt thingy if you don't mind!
question: # 2 for the prompt thingy if you don't mind!
answer:
2) If I don’t die from this I deem myself immortal.

When Peter says that he’s a smart ass it’s because he is. When he says his mentor, aka Tony f u c k i n g Stark, he means that all of his smart assery is nothing compared to the older man.

The thing is, Peter notes, is that Tony uses sarcasm as a shield just like Peter did. The thing is, when you have two people who have no sense of protecting themselves in a stressful situation you don’t go that far in solving said stressful situation.

Take the situation in which Tony got stabbed in a battle for instance. The only other person around was Spider-Man who is known for how much he talks while fighting his enemies.

“Mr. Stark! Ohmygod ohmygod ohmygod-”

“Kid stop- stop panicking. I’m the one who has something going through me right now.”

“I’m sorry, Mr. Stark,” Peter snipped, putting pressure on the wound just like he was taught, “Let me just jump around in joy and laugh like a maniac. Would that be better?”

Tony barked out a laugh, wincing when the knife that went through his theigh was moved. “Touché, Kid. But don’t worry I’ve had worse.”

Peter flares up at his mentor, “That doesn’t really help in this situation, though, does it?”

“In fact,” Tony went on as if Peter hadn’t said anything, “I’ve avoided death so many times… Afghanistan, Loki’s little half attempt at taking over New York, getting black out drunk…”

“Mr. Stark,” Peter scoffed in disbelief. Now was so not the time!

“So, Kid, if I don’t die from this, I deem myself immortal.”

Peter just raised an eyebrow, waving down Sam who was flying around looking for them, “I don’t think that’s how it works.”

“Sure it is,” Tony slurred, the blood loss was beginning effect him more than Peter thought. “Just ask… I dunno- Wilson? Wade Wilson?”

“I’m pretty sure Wade didn’t become immortal by declaring himself as such.”

“So how did he get his powers?” Tony asked as The Falcon finally touched ground besides the mentor and mentee.

“When I asked he said there’s this guy named Stan Lee.”

“Stan?” Tony scoffed, “Yeah, that sounds as believable as me deeming myself immortal.”

“Mr. Stark! Ohmygod ohmygod ohmygod-”

“Kid stop- stop panicking. I’m the one who has something going through me right now.”

“I’m sorry, Mr. Stark,” Peter snipped, putting pressure on the wound just like he was taught, “Let me just jump around in joy and laugh like a maniac. Would that be better?”

Tony barked out a laugh, wincing when the knife that went through his theigh was moved. “Touché, Kid. But don’t worry I’ve had worse.”

Peter flares up at his mentor, “That doesn’t really help in this situation, though, does it?”

“In fact,” Tony went on as if Peter hadn’t said anything, “I’ve avoided death so many times… Afghanistan, Loki’s little half attempt at taking over New York, getting black out drunk…”

“Mr. Stark,” Peter scoffed in disbelief. Now was so not the time!

“So, Kid, if I don’t die from this, I deem myself immortal.”

Peter just raised an eyebrow, waving down Sam who was flying around looking for them, “I don’t think that’s how it works.”

“Sure it is,” Tony slurred, the blood loss was beginning effect him more than Peter thought. “Just ask… I dunno- Wilson? Wade Wilson?”

“I’m pretty sure Wade didn’t become immortal by declaring himself as such.”

“So how did he get his powers?” Tony asked as The Falcon finally touched ground besides the mentor and mentee.

“When I asked he said there’s this guy named Stan Lee.”

“Stan?” Tony scoffed, “Yeah, that sounds as believable as me deeming myself immortal.”

Cause my honey is calling me
It's been a long time coming,
Just to see...
body:
Jailbird

I’ve got the shackles around my wrists

I got to get free

title: gfdsg
body:
read it on the AO3 at http://bit.ly/2UTDA8M

by starkravingfangirl

Steve had missed the glares and looks from the Avengers, as Tony drifted farther and farther away. These days, Steve was always on missions; SHIELD was so close to defeating HYDRA, and who better to deliver the killing blow than Captain America, HYDRA’s sworn enemy? But Captain America was also Steve Rogers, and sometimes Steve forgot that he had a family that needed him too.

summary:
Okay but Singing in the Rain came out in 1952. 
Just imagine Tony convincing Steve that this scene was totally based on his very...
body:
Okay but Singing in the Rain came out in 1952.

Just imagine Tony convincing Steve that this scene was totally based on his very similar efforts during the war campaign and taking every single opportunity to tease the absolute hell out of Steve.

Humming under his breath as he makes his coffee in the morning, swinging his hips as he walks past Steve sketching on the couch, maybe even putting on a short skirt and some lipstick one night…?


@randomstufffromotherblogs
